column2: exsultémus Dòmino~; jubilémus Deo salutári nostro~; ^ Come
column3: let us praise the Lord with joy~; let us joyfully sing to God our saviour~;

column2: et in psalmîs jubilémus ei~; ^ let us come before his presence with thanksgiving~; and make a joyful noise to him with psalms~;
et Rex magnus super omnes Deos. ^ for the Lord is a great God
column3: and a great King above all gods.

column1: 4 ^ Qŭia in manu ejus sunt omnes fines terraĕ
column2: et altitúdines mòntium ipsíus sunt~; ^ For in his hand are all the ends of the earth
column3: and the heights of the mountains are his~;
et siccam manûs ejus formavérunt. ^ for the sea is his
column5: and his hands formed the dry land.

column3: et plorémus ante Dòminum qŭi fecit nos~; ^ Come
column4: let us adore and fall down
column5: and weep before the Lord that made us~;

column1: 7 ^ qŭia ipse est Dòminus Deus noster
column3: et oves manûs ejus. ^ for he is the Lord our God
column4: and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand.

column5: ^ Today if you shall hear his voice
column8: according to the day of temptation in the wilderness

column3: et vîdérunt ópera mea. ^ where your fathers tempted me

column1: 10 ^ Quadragìnta annîs offènsus fui generatióni illi
column3: «~Semper hi errant corde.~»^ Forty years long was I offended with that generation

column1: 11 ^ Et ìsti non cognovérunt vias meas~; ut jurávi in ira mea
column2: «~Si introíbunt in rèquiem meam.~»^ And these men have not known my ways~; so I swore in my wrath
column3: "If they shall not enter into my rest."
